title: Latest Arkansas sports
text:
Latest Arkansas sports - KATV - Breaking News, Weather and Razorback Sports Member Center: 
ARKANSAS-TENNESSEE 
Arkansas tops Tennessee to end three-game skid 
KNOXVILLE, Tenn. (AP) - Alex Collins rushed for 154 yards and two touchdowns Saturday as Arkansas defeated Tennessee 24-20 to snap a three-game skid and end its recent history of frustration in close games. 
The Razorbacks (2-3, 1-1 SEC) entered the night having lost their last 10 games decided by seven points or less, with nine of those defeats coming since Bret Bielema took over the program in 2013. 
Arkansas erased a 14-0 deficit and hung on despite wasting two second-half trips to the red zone on a blocked field goal and an unsuccessful fake field-goal attempt. Collins produced his third straight 150-yard game and put Arkansas ahead for good with a 1-yard touchdown run in the third quarter. 
Collins got help from Rawleigh Williams, who rushed for 100 yards. 
Jalen Hurd ran for 90 yards for Tennessee (2-3, 0-2), which lost by blowing a two-touchdown lead for the third time in four weeks. 
IDAHO-ARKANSAS ST 
Arkansas State beats Idaho 49-35 
JONESBORO, Ark. (AP) - Michael Gordon ran for three touchdowns to lead Arkansas State to a 49-35 win over Idaho in Sun Belt Conference play on Saturday night. 
Gordon carried 26 times for 221 yards for the Red Wolves (2-3, 1-0). Johnston White ran for two touchdowns and James Tabary threw for 188 yards and a score. 
After an Idaho interception return for a score early in the second quarter, Gordon responded with a 59-yard touchdown run to tie it 14-14. The Red Wolves also scored on their next two possessions, on a 2-yard run by White followed by another TD run by Gordon to lift the team to a 28-14 lead at halftime. 
Gordon posted his third touchdown on a 10-yard run midway through the third quarter to stretch the Red Wolves' lead to 35-14. 
Jake Luton had 166 yards for the Vandals (1-4, 0-2) and was intercepted three times. 
ALCORN ST-ARK-PINE BLUFF 
Alcorn State runs to 61-14 win over Arkansas-Pine Bluff 
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) - Joe Price and Darryan Ragsdale spearheaded a dominant rushing attack, leading Alcorn State to a 61-14 neutral site win over Arkansas-Pine Bluff on Saturday night. 
Price and Ragsdale each went over the 100-yard mark and scored on runs of 50 and 65 yards, respectively. Both touchdowns came in the first quarter as the Braves (4-1, 3-0 Southwestern Athletic Conference) built a 28-7 lead. John Gibbs, Jr. rushed for three scores and passed for two more, hitting 7 of 10 passes for 103 yards. Alcorn State rushed 50 times for 418 yards and six scores. 
The Golden Lions (1-4, 0-3) tied it at 7-all when Marcus Terrell found Kyle Coleman for a 10-yard score. But it was all Alcorn State from there, with the Braves scoring 53 of the game's next 60 points. Terrell finished 8 of 15 for 74 yards and two interceptions. 
ABILENE CHRISTIAN-CENT ARKANSAS 
Central Arkansas rolls over Abilene Christian 42-14 
CONWAY, Ark. (AP) - Hayden Hildebrand threw for 210 yards and two touchdowns to lead Central Arkansas to a 42-14 victory over Abilene Christian Saturday night. 
Dominique Thomas rushed 21 times for 126 yards and one touchdown as Central Arkansas (2-2, 2-0 Southland Conference) jumped out to a 32-7 halftime advantage and coasted to the win. 
The Bears had 469 total yards -259 rushing and 210 passing - while limiting Abilene Christian (2-2, 2-1) to 272. 
Ricky Wyatt led the defense with nine tackles and Garrett Sharp had seven for Central Arkansas. 
Hildebrand passed to seven different receivers as Cody Dauksch grabbed two passes for 57 yards. Jatavious Wilson and Thomas caught one each for 53 and 49 yards, respectively. 
Parker McKenzie threw for 157 yards and two touchdowns for the Wildcats. De'Andre Brown rushed 13 times for 90 yards for ACU.
